Title: Certified Dental Assistant - Salmon Arm, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Salmon Arm Dental is expanding and currently accepting applications for Certified Dental Assistants!
As a certified dental assistant, you will be required to perform a variety of duties, including some administrative tasks.
Duties cover, but are not limited to: managing patient appointments and maintaining dental records; assisting dentists during procedures; setting up treatment rooms and maintaining a sterile environment for rooms and equipment; take and process x-rays and dental impressions.
Why you should apply to join the Salmon Arm Dental Team:
- Competitive salary
- Uniform allowance
- Dental benefits
- Botox/Dysport below cost
- Great team atmosphere
- Bonus incentives/competitions
- Continuing education (CE) credits and training
Please submit resume and cover letter via email

Title: Chairside Dental Assistant - Kamloops, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job description
Kamloops Pediatric Dentistry specializing in oral care and surgery for children. We are looking for full and part-time Dental Assistants to support our practice.
Kamloops Pediatric Dentistry is willing to train the right candidate as a Chairside Dental Assistant.
We offer a competitive compensation package, encourage, and support continuous learning and development.
The ideal candidate will be able to create a comforting environment for children of all ages and abilities during their care and treatment at our clinic.
The ideal candidate will also be interested in completing education to become a Certified Dental Assistant.
Kamloops Pediatric Dentistry values integrity, teamwork, continuous learning, and commitment. We are here to provide exceptional care to children and their families in an environment that is compassionate and collaborative.
Job Summary
The
Chairside
Dental Assistant
is an important team member and supports the Dentist, and the team, in providing exceptional care to pediatric patients. They assists the Dentist with all treatments and care provided to pediatric patients.
Key Responsibilities
Greets and settles pediatric patients for treatment; helping them feel comfortable upon arrival.
Prepares the patient for dental procedures and surgeries.
Assists the Dentist with a variety of treatment procedures.
Provides excellent pediatric care to patients.
Provides postoperative care and instructions as directed by the Dentist.
Collects and records patient’s medical and dental history and may take vital signs as required.
Assists in any testing required prior to procedures being performed; ensures patient chart is current, signed consents received, and appropriate radiograph images are in place.
Conducts patient charting in a fully digital and chartless clinic environment.
Ensures turnover and set up of rooms are completed efficiently.
Ensures infection control protocols are maintained; cleans and sterilizes treatment rooms, instruments and sets up equipment and supplies for each procedure.
Performs other related duties as required.
Qualifications
Current certification in Basic Life Support is required and Pediatric Advanced Life Support (PALS) is an asset.
Interest in completing a Certified Dental Assistant certificate program.
An equivalent combination of education, skills and experience may be considered.
Skills and Abilities
Comfortable working with children of all abilities and needs.
Excellent pediatric patient support and service, interpersonal and relationship building skills with proven diplomacy.
Possesses high degree of compassion, patience, empathy and emotional intelligence.
Possesses high standards of professional conduct; performs quality work with the highest degree of accuracy.
Strong ethical standards and ability to safeguard patient privacy and confidentiality.
Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational skills, and attention to detail.
Able to perform multiple tasks, balance priorities and meet deadlines without close supervision. Adaptable to respond to the needs of the office and stay calm in all situations.
Takes initiative and has a high level of ambition; motivated.
Able to work independently and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team. Works collaboratively with the Dentist and front-end staff.
Experience in MacPractice, or experience with comparable dental software an asset.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Application question(s):
Are you located in Kamloops, BC?
Experience:
Dental Assisting: 1 year (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Periodontist - Dawson Dental Kingston - Kingston, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About us:
Dawson Dental Kingston is located on Queen Street across from the Kingston Commerce Centre, we are committed to the surrounding Petawawa and 1000 Island communities.
At Dawson Dental, you will be working alongside a talented, driven, and dedicated team that works like a family. Dawson Dental strives to provide the highest level of patient care. We ensure that our patients have a very positive memorable experience.
We pride ourselves on providing quality dental care and 4.9 stars on Google reviews, evidence of our exceptional patient service, commitment to continuous learning, and innovative technology.
Additionally, through working within the dentalcorp network, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from some of the industry's leading clinicians and have greater access to the advanced treatment technologies and training & development, and support.
https://dawsondental.ca/locations/kingston-dentist/
Schedule: 1 Day/mo
The Opportunity
We are currently looking to hire a
Periodontist
to join our busy and well-established practice. The successful candidate will have a passion for building strong patient relationships and contributing to the ongoing oral health of their community. As an Associate Dentist at our practice, you will be part of a team of dental professionals, with a variety of learning opportunities through mentorship and industry-leading continuing education.
Why Should You Join?
Career development
: A career with us ensures you have the support, tools, and encouragement you need to grow and evolve as a professional on your individual career path, including access to industry-leading continuing education through the award-winning DC Institute (dcinstitute.ca) and a dedicated Clinical Mentor.
Competitive compensation & benefits
: Our compensation packages are reviewed annually in a comparative study that ensures alignment with industry standards.
Established and stable practice:
Our successful practice is a leader in patient care, providing a range of services to a loyal and established patient base.
Health & Safety and Compliance
: The practice has a strong health and safety culture, with compliance measures embedded in every aspect of the workplace.
Network of experienced dental professionals
: You will have opportunities for formal and structured mentorship with esteemed team members and colleagues and access to industry-leading experts in various dental disciplines.
Team-oriented:
When you join our practice, you join a team of supportive and like-minded professionals working together to achieve common goals that are understood and shared by all.
Respect for our people
: The team is built on a culture of respect and positivity, where we celebrate individuality and value each other's unique strengths and contributions.
Work-life flexibility
: Everyone has a life outside the practice, and we are committed to helping each team member find a healthy, sustainable balance between home and career.
About You:
Graduate from an accredited DDS/DMD Program or successful completion of the National Dental Examining Board of Canada (NDEB) Equivalency Process
Registered, licensed and in good standing with the Royal College of Dental Surgeons of Ontario (R.C.D.S.O)
Valid CPR certification
dentalcorp Total Rewards + Perks
Team members have access to a range of resources focused on enhancing their personal and professional lives. We provide annual compensation reviews, voluntary RRSP contributions, and industry-leading learning and development opportunities. Our team members also enjoy extensive discounts on many services and activities including an exclusive corporate gym membership program; reduced rates on home and auto insurance; and unlimited access to a variety of discounted entertainment, hotels, products and services. Our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) connects team members and their families with complimentary, confidential, short-term counseling and advisory services. dentalcorp is continuously evolving and enhancing the programs to offer our team members exclusive benefits that complement their lifestyle.
Candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada. We thank all applicants, but only suitable applicants will be contacted. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Team at
416-558-3883
. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

Title: Orthodontic Dental Hygienist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
ABOUT US
We make Toronto smile!
City Dental Toronto is a rapidly growing dental group with numerous dental practices in downtown Toronto.
Our amazing team of dentists, hygienists, administrators and auxiliary staff deliver the highest quality of care to thousands of patients in downtown Toronto. Our people provide our patients with the highest level of care through innovation, technology and a commitment to a superior experience.
We are looking for more skilled and passionate people to help take us to the next level.
POSITION: Orthodontic Dental Hygienist
We are currently searching for a motivated Orthodontic Dental Hygienist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have an amazing ability to connect with people and motivate them to achieve a beautiful, healthy smile. Confident clinical skills and a team-first attitude are a must. This role involves a combination of both regular and orthodontic hygiene services.
Responsibilities:
Assess dental conditions and risk using patient screening procedures, including medical history review, dental charting and perio-charting.
Deliver direct patient care to patients as assigned using established dental hygiene procedures, such as cleaning, polishing, radiographs, application of sealants, fluorides and varnishes and related procedures.
Identify and educate patients on dental disease and treatment recommendations
Invisalign iTero scanning, bonding Invisalign attachments, delivering Invisalign trays and providing Invisalign care instructions.
Work with Dentist(s) to develop and implement individualized dental care plans for patients.
Educate patients on oral health plans and prevention strategies.
Document dental history, records and reports observations and patient reactions, documents lab procedures and ensures follow ups
Use down-time to clean and restock operatories, assists in the preparation of patient care areas, sterilizing instruments, etc.
Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in Orthodontics, with a specific focus on Invisalign
Knowledge of Invisalign and iTero processes and procedures an asset*
Knowledge of provincial regulations and guidelines for the provision of dental hygiene services.
Knowledge of clinical processes and workflows.
Knowledge of administrative processes and workflows (insurance and dental codes).
Ability to perform a full range of established dental hygiene protocols and procedures.
Knowledge of patient screening, charting, medical history procedures and documentation.
Great attitude, work ethic and communication skills
Exceptional time management and organizational skills
Patient-focused attitude
Education/Licensure Requirements
Registered Dental Hygienist from an accredited program with a current license to practice in the Province of Ontario.
Current CPR certification.
Pursuit of continuing education as required to maintain licensure and stay abreast of advances in the field of dentistry, especially in areas related to the scope of dental hygiene practice
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Wellness program
Schedule:
10 hour shift
12 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Application question(s):
Are you able to work Downtown Toronto?
Experience:
Invisalign: 1 year (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Dental Assistant Level II - Milton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We are currently looking for one caring and compassionate Dental Assistant for our Pediatric Dentistry practice. Little Bird Pediatric Dentistry (LB), owned by Dr. Alison Sigal, is located in Milton, Ontario and differs greatly from a traditional dental office both in design and operation.
Our practice is focused on multidisciplinary, collaborative airway-focused pediatric dental health care with two main focuses:
1) To optimize our children's, especially babies, growth and development through newborn baby assessments, educational workshops and airway driven new patient exams. Our belief is that through optimizing our children’s and babies ability to breathe and eat/feed, we will also be optimizing their ability to chew, swallow, sleep, and develop. With this in mind, we desire for our Dental Assistants to become educated in Orofacial Myofunctional Therapy (OMT).
2) The second focus of LB is in the provision of care for persons with special needs of all ages.
Our Dental Assistants must desire to learn and be interested in caring for both patient populations.
Our practice features a design that feels like home, a calm environment and incredible team. Working at Little Bird will both challenge and reward you in a variety of ways. Please visit our website at www.littlebirddental.ca to learn more.
Primary Responsibilities
1) Medical history update and risk management assessment of patients
2) Provide patient education as pertains to: Airway, Growth and Development, Function, Diet, Sleep, Orofacial Myofunctional Disorders and Oral Hygiene
3) Provision of Orofacial Myofunctional Therapy
4) Provision of preventive dental care
5) Accurate and comprehensive record keeping
6) Clean and sterilize instruments
Examples of Specific Duties Include (But Are Not Limited To):
Office Management
1) Manage day-to-day dental assisting operations of practice (preparation of the treatment/clinical area)
2) Ensure operatory where assigned is fully stocked with materials needed for the day’s procedures/treatments
Patient Management
1) Maintain a welcoming and organized clinical area; ensure stocked with dental and educational materials.
2) Take radiographs as requested and as qualified with the Ministry of Health, under the Healing Arts Radiation Protection Act (HARP)
3) Recall examinations (*Applicable only for Level II CDA):
4) Once have appropriate training/education, Lead Orofacial Myofunctional Therapy Sessions
Skills required for Level I CDA will include: passing instruments, proper use of high and low volume evacuators, preparation of restorative materials, mix and dispense dental materials, holding a surgical flap that has been prepared/reflected by Pediatric Dentist, oral hygiene instruction and risk management education (extra-oral).
Furthermore for a Level II CDA additional skills required will include: Under supervision from a Pediatric Dentist - Polishing of teeth, placement and removal of rubber dam, placement of alloy in a cavity preparation excluding condensing/carving, taking dental impressions, topical application of anti-cariogenic agents, oral hygiene instruction and risk management education with intra-oral component, dietary counseling, application of pit and fissure sealants and oral irrigation.
6) Maintain organized and clean clinical and sterilization areas. Follow inflection control protocol as directed by College (RCDSO). Clean, sterilize and maintain instruments, suctions and general equipment. Conduct spore/biological indicator tests. Lubricate handpieces. Clean suction lines, basket filters, operatory and main suction traps.
Candidate Requirements
A) Education/Experience
1) Completion of post-secondary Dental Assistant Diploma from a recognized College (Level I or II Position Available)
2) Must have HARP Certification
3) Office experience preferred but not required
4) Experience working or interacting with persons with special needs an asset
5) Fluent in oral and written English
6) Desire to become educated and trained in Orofacial Myofunctional Therapy (OMT)
B) Interpersonal
1) Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to empathize and show compassion with all interactions (patients, staff members, doctors and greater community)
2) Calm, positive and effective verbal communication skills
3) Enthusiastic team player that thrives in an independent, empowered environment
4) Desire for continued education/learning and growth as an individual and member of the practice team. Ability to share current knowledge and office practices with the public, patients and community.
5) Ability to constructively self-reflect, receive feedback and have productive dialogues relating to potential areas of improvement
6) Able to adapt to office policy improvements (practice is constantly striving for improved patient care/service)
Additional Position Details
1) Full Time position 4-5 days per week: Clinic hours 8AM-5:00PM
We look forward to your application!

High school or equivalent
